name: Credit Card Blocking Scam
description: Scammer sends fake transaction alert about SBI credit card usage at Amazon, urging victim to call and share details to 'block' the card.

turns.scammer_message: Your SBI Credit Card ending 4567 has been used for a transaction of Rs 49,999 at Amazon. If this was not you, call immediately to block your card.
turns.notes: Initial fake transaction alert to create panic.

turns.scammer_message: We understand this is alarming. To immediately block your card and reverse the unauthorized transaction, please contact our 24x7 fraud helpline at +91-9900110022. Do not delay.
turns.notes: Phone number revealed for fake fraud helpline.

turns.scammer_message: To process the reversal of Rs 49,999, our system requires a security deposit of Rs 999. Please transfer to our secure account 4567890123456789. This will be refunded along with the reversed amount within 48 hours.

You can also pay the security deposit via UPI for instant processing. Send Rs 999 to sbi.card.security@ybl. Your card will be blocked and the amount of Rs 49,999 will be reversed to your account immediately.
turns.notes: UPI ID revealed as faster payment option.

turns.scammer_message: URGENT: Another transaction of Rs 35,000 is being attempted on your card RIGHT NOW. Pay security deposit to sbi.card.security@ybl or account 4567890123456789 immediately. Call +91-9900110022 for emergency blocking.
turns.notes: Escalation with second fake transaction, all details repeated.
